title: league turned my friends into assholes.
body:
just some personal rant leave if your not interested in this stuff

one of my easygoing friends got into league awhile ago.

now whenever i call him all he talks about are his amazing katarina plays and how hes rllyy good and hes sick of all these trash teams feeding blah blah blah blah blah.

id try to change the subject into something else but THEN HE REMINDS ME OF HOW GOOD HE IS AT YASUO and bam back to his league rant.

i feel like his whole ego is just built around league of legends. whenever he does some kind of misplay or gets outplayed the opponent is OP.

its like he is denying everything. maybe to impress me ? he forgets that it is ok to mess up if you can learn from it, and that I really dont care anymore if you walk into a lux ult like omg just be HONEST WITH ME.

i tried talking to him about this but he wont listen.

it was until he started calling out my mistakes and calling me a retard that i just completely shut him out cos i didnt know what to do. i dont know how to be a good friend :(

its so frustrating because before he was that type of guy that would write a fricken 2 page poem to someone he liked on valentines day and then buy them a whole bouquet of roses and sing a song or other corny crap.

but like every toxic person hes just not cut out for multiplayer video games and i wanna just pull him out so bad.

so whenever you see a toxic person PLEASE REMEMBER TO REPORT THEM 

toxic people dont just hurt the people on their team. they hurt their own friends too. and they are just ruining themselves by constantly playing this game.

and i know i should be treating my friend better somehow but im too dumb so..

EDIT: i didnt mean for friends to be plural, but oh well

UPDATE: we arent friends anymore, he found this post lmao.

ANOTHER UPDATE: just kidding, he was in a bad mood, but he has chosen to accept that i dont want to be friends with him anymore and has decided to move on anyway, with quote.

"i dont deserve good people like you anyway"

maybe i should give him another shot. I refuse to believe this game completely moulded his personality.

replies.body:
this game is a curse. Exposure to toxicity moulds people, you may think you are pure, but it moulds you.

From one of the sweetest people to a horrible Grinch. The only cure is to smash their laptop and put them in a straight jacket for a few weeks, then lock them in the closet.

> [{quoted}](name=Talon12,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=9d1XoErO,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-03-16T11:13:42.460+0000)
>
> this game is a curse. Exposure to toxicity moulds people, you may think you are pure, but it moulds you.
> 
> From one of the sweetest people to a horrible Grinch. The only cure is to smash their laptop and put them in a straight jacket for a few weeks, then lock them in the closet.

Keep that blaming the victim up

there is no "blaming the victim up" crap, its the simple hard truth, Being surrounded by thieves too long, eventually you will start stealing too. Same goes for a positive environment. If a negative person is surrounded by positive upbeat people for long enough, eventually they would into a positive upbeat person too. The fact is, above lv 15 the environment of the game becomes so negative it moulds others into negativity too.

No matter how hard I try to, I just can't accept this line of reasoning. It might take effort to go against the grain but it will always be possible. There are people in this game who are overwhelmingly positive and no matter how much exposure to negativity they may experience they rarely, if ever, falter.

> [{quoted}](name=Nijiiyo,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=9d1XoErO,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2016-03-18T07:06:41.855+0000)
>
> No matter how hard I try to, I just can't accept this line of reasoning. It might take effort to go against the grain but it will always be possible. There are people in this game who are overwhelmingly positive and no matter how much exposure to negativity they may experience they rarely, if ever, falter.

If mud is kicked on someone down the street and they stay smiling every day, the individual who is smiling will be seen to be a 'moron' or a 'pussy' etc.  At some point you are disrespecting yourself by taking it. Someone who takes abuse and never stands up for themselves. Do you know how bad it is that you are adopting these pussified serf-like attitudes being fed to you like retards? Really.

Thanks for insulting me. I hope the fact I won't insult you back doesn't make you think too little of me ; )

There's a major difference between defending yourself and debasing yourself. You can communicate with negative people in ways that aren't negative themselves, kinda like I am right now.

At the end of the day you pick your battles and arguing with people online is not a battle worth fighting. Nobody wins, but maybe maintaining a sense of ego is a good enough reason for people to give it a shot anyway.
Couldn't have said it better myself.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=9d1XoErO,comment-id=0000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-19T00:23:18.320+0000)
>
> Couldn't have said it better myself.

He's agreeing with me without knowing it. Although debasing yourself is allowing people to spit in your face. He was trying to say being nice to those bullying you will work, an extremely stupid and unrealistic idea. But the rest of his remarks are agreeing with me. I just do not apply unrealistic, naive standards upon real world situations, unlike you two.

Defending himself was responding to your comment with his reasoning. Though it's your choice whether or not you choose to listen to his reasoning or to just say it's dumb.

Debasing himself would have been to insult you back and to give in to your negativity. Such is the distinction.

You don't have to be nice to anyone, just like you don't have to be mean to anyone. It's a choice YOU make. Even if they started it, might be harder to choose not to be mean to them, doesn't mean it's not still a choice.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=9d1XoErO,comment-id=000000010000000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2016-03-19T01:17:59.875+0000)
>
> Defending himself was responding to your comment with his reasoning. Though it's your choice whether or not you choose to listen to his reasoning or to just say it's dumb.
> 
> Debasing himself would have been to insult you back and to give in to your negativity. Such is the distinction.
> 
> You don't have to be nice to anyone, just like you don't have to be mean to anyone. It's a choice YOU make. Even if they started it, might be harder to choose not to be mean to them, doesn't mean it's not still a choice.

You're wrong in that calling me negative and associating me with the subject matter is a  mischaracterisation of my post. Exceedingly passive aggressive insinuation like that just oozes negativity tyvm and I don't like it. You can conceal negativity with this kind of pretense that you have and is what you have, in fact, done.
 
I am 100% right and that is a fact.

No intentionally, but it's pretty clear you took it that way. I was trying to explain his reasoning and the distinction he was making to you in my own words.

You DID insult him, insinuating he was seen as "a 'moron' or a 'pussy'" for refusing to be negative about something, and insulting someone who is trying to have a discussion can fairly safely be considered negative.

I'm trying to be diplomatic here, to defend Nijiiyo because I believe he has the right attitude here, and to help you understand his reasoning and you have responded with barely veiled aggression. 

You don't have to agree to accept someone's point of view. I just don't quite understand why you are being so aggressive to Nijiiyo when he is only trying to have a discussion, it really is unnecessary. He isn't attacking you, so you have no need to defend yourself, especially in this manner.

I don't feel particularly strongly about your responses either way so I have no real reason to be negative. I'm simply responding to what you have said to the best of my ability and understanding. NOONE is 100% right in discussions like these, it's just not possible. Even what applies to a vast majority will not apply to everyone, and we have no way of fully understanding someone else's perspective. Noone can be completely right here.

That's not true at all. When I contrast defending and debasing, I'm contrasting the value of being "assertive" over being outright negative. At no point do I suggest you should never defend yourself or be nice to those who are negative but rather that you should not debase (lower one's standards) by matching negativity with negativity. There is always a better way to communicate with these kinds of people.

> [{quoted}](name=Nijiiyo,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=9d1XoErO,comment-id=000000010000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-19T01:04:45.254+0000)
>
> That's not true at all. When I contrast defending and debasing, I'm contrasting the value of being "assertive" over being outright negative. At no point do I suggest you should never defend yourself or be nice to those who are negative but rather that you should not debase (lower one's standards) by matching negativity with negativity. There is always a better way to communicate with these kinds of people.

Well you are optimistic but optimism and idealistic positivity is unrealistic.

> [{quoted}](name=Nijiiyo,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=9d1XoErO,comment-id=000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-18T12:58:15.436+0000)
>
> Thanks for insulting me. I hope the fact I won't insult you back doesn't make you think too little of me ; )
> 
> There's a major difference between defending yourself and debasing yourself. You can communicate with negative people in ways that aren't negative themselves, kinda like I am right now.
> 
> At the end of the day you pick your battles and arguing with people online is not a battle worth fighting. Nobody wins, but maybe maintaining a sense of ego is a good enough reason for people to give it a shot anyway.

I wouldn't mind knowing where you get your loopy naive notions about social interactions from?

> [{quoted}](name=Nijiiyo,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=9d1XoErO,comment-id=000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-18T12:58:15.436+0000)
>
> Thanks for insulting me. I hope the fact I won't insult you back doesn't make you think too little of me ; )
> 
> There's a major difference between defending yourself and debasing yourself. You can communicate with negative people in ways that aren't negative themselves, kinda like I am right now.
> 
> At the end of the day you pick your battles and arguing with people online is not a battle worth fighting. Nobody wins, but maybe maintaining a sense of ego is a good enough reason for people to give it a shot anyway.

You simply are agreeing with me. Debasing yourself is saying nothing. Next time read my comment.

There is another trait between passive and aggressive. It's called Assertive. That guy who lets people kid mud on him will build up rage till he breaks down. The person who vents his rage by directing it at others isn't the person you should stride to be. It doesn't make you tough. By being assertive, you can communicate your wants and needs without aggression and receive better results from even stubborn people.
Yes its possible to go against it, its just the fact that around 80% of the toxic people in oce actually started out as sweet people. Not everyone has the willpower to fight it.
That's not how it works. I was surrounded by potheads... Didn't make me one.

> [{quoted}](name=Talon12,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=9d1XoErO,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2016-03-17T09:32:20.208+0000)
>
> there is no "blaming the victim up" crap, its the simple hard truth, Being surrounded by thieves too long, eventually you will start stealing too. 

Speak for yourself. Read this line: 

> Exposure to toxicity moulds people, you may think you are pure, but it moulds you.

If you are are dirtbag, don't project it onto others. Calling someone who is abused for being harrassed in a game a thief is extremely obnoxious and it's an inaccurate comparison. Do you know how you're doing that and why it's a bad comparison  or do I have to explain it to you? The logic of thievery being spread like a disease is also just wierd.

the point is, if you are around bad people, you are more likely to become a bad person yourself, even if it is only in the game.

And being surrounded by theives, 90% of people would become a theif too, even if it is only to steal back their own things, asking is unlikely to work, and as such, after a certain point, that person will start to steal too.

> [{quoted}](name=Talon12,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=9d1XoErO,comment-id=00000001000000010000,timestamp=2016-03-18T09:08:40.286+0000)
>
> the point is, if you are around bad people, you are more likely to become a bad person yourself, even if it is only in the game.

You are not bad because you are abused ffs. The people abusing you are bad. Read my reply to Niiiyo.
Maybe not, but if it happens enough, you can become one of them. A simple point.

> [{quoted}](name=Talon12,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=9d1XoErO,comment-id=0000000100000001000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-18T09:11:53.644+0000)
>
> Maybe not, but if it happens enough, you can become one of them. A simple point.

You are leaving out a key point which is, "enough and nothing is done to stop the abuse by those in charge of stopping it, you" which changes the tone entirely.

a malicious environment has a population of 99% malicious people.  There can be the 1% of sweet, but because its malicious most of the others are malicious. 

A Bad neighborhood has negative effects on a child does it not? You could see the game as that. A negative environment has a negative effect on the people. Become one in the same, even if it is only online.

People are affected by their environment and adapt to be more like it, believe it or not. so if they are surrounded by negativity for long enough, they too can become negative.

> People are affected by their environment and adapt to be more like it, believe it or not. so if they are surrounded by negativity for long enough, they too can become negative.

To everyone who is wondering why all these good kids that go into high school suddenly become rude and smoke weed.. This.

One of my old acquainted treats me like trash now because of older seniors -.-

> [{quoted}](name=Talon12,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=9d1XoErO,comment-id=00000001000000010000,timestamp=2016-03-18T09:08:40.286+0000)
>
> And being surrounded by theives, 90% of people would become a theif too, even if it is only to steal back their own things, asking is unlikely to work, and as such, after a certain point, that person will start to steal too.

You can't "steal" back your own things.  lol
technically if its stolen and they claim ownership of it, and do not return it, its stealing if you take it back

it did mould me. i will admit it was hard to see why not to be mad at people when they feed but
edit: pros moulded me too. things like "ask yourself what did you do wrong when you died" really changed alot of peoples perspective.

and I would consider smashing his laptop but he lives far away now :(

I know the feel.
{{champion:32}} 

I think it's an important thing to tackle early on, and if you miss the chance, you risk them thinking they're 100% in the right and before you know it they're asking how you got to Silver/Gold and how the ranked system is busted and they're always stuck in ELO hell..

I have friends who still can't believe I'd rather play games with "x" feeder or "x" incompetent player _because they don't flame_, Instead of playing with literally anyone else with the chance that someone else can at least carry a game.
It's all about winning. Apparently

I have friends that go on tilt, some for rediculous things that should never matter like ***skins***.
***SKINS***.

Admittedly, I've never played a game against a Soul Reaver Draven that didn't hard carry, but that doesn't mean I'm no longer capable of trying or enjoying myself just because that one person has a skin I've associated with a likely ability to carry.

I don't flame teammates for giving the draven first blood or giving him a penta, I instead choose to acknowledge the Draven probably beat us for a reason.

I'd love to be able to figure a way to change the way majority of people think about the game.

> I'd love to be able to figure a way to change the way majority of people think about the game.

Me too buddy, though I'm not convinced this can actually be a reality anymore. This was something I had to realise on my own tbh.
Ended a friendship over a post. Lol what a douche he was not a good friend

HAHAHAH well my 'friend' found this post and instantly confronted me about it saying that im an idiot and im making all this up and how he NEVER REMEMBERS ANY OF THIS WUT.

and he never wants to be friends with me ever again.

i still kind of feel sad about it because things ended kind of roughly and my friends are friends with him so its super awkward but i couldnt handle him anymore.

i guess i literally lost one friend to league. sigh.

completely off topic, but wouldnt it be funny if a toxic person was typing mean things to someone who ends up being the love of his life, but at the time the toxic person only sees that person as just another scrub and nothing more.

im think alot when im tired but not really tired.

use /mute feature
ignore him and go on with your lovely life
dont waste your time energy on these kind of people

thats the #1 tip to get out of bronze

What Rank is he? 
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}
*placing bet on Bronze

bronze 2.

edit: dont think this is important. besides, he got bronze 2 from placements.

infact i havent been friends with him for a couple months now, so he could of gone higher.
good bye my friend.

I dont seem to be able to get my mates into LoL. They're all a bit older (30+) and I think they are time poor and the learning curve is so gradual that it takes a fairly significant investment of time to git gud.
They are right into HotS though - much easier to pick up and shorter average game lengths.
Riot just banned my account for something i didn't do. I'm now one of those assholes. It's a perm ban. GG your game.

I'd imagine there would be ways to get your account back.
Just send a report to someone, or get the attention of someone whom works at riot and they'll review the ban.
If they see that it was indeed a falsely placed ban they should be able to lift it.
I've made 2 discussions and have 7 support tickets. Riot refuse to help.
Then don't play with him anymore, lol.
Let him cry a river from his tears because your ex-friend will come back :)

> [{quoted}](name=Jencarna,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=9d1XoErO,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-03-16T11:04:18.699+0000)
>
> so whenever you see a toxic person PLEASE REMEMBER TO REPORT THEM 

Snitch ðŸ‘®

na he just grew out of his wimpy phase and realised that being nice is pointless. this is who he truly is. this is a big part of his life. he takes it seriously because he wants to win and have something to show for all his time spent on a game. if he was challenger he would feel his success and dedication to the game is justified with a prestigious achievement

if he really is just a douche irl now, you should probably not be his friend if hes so intolerable. if he takes games with you so seriously that he has to berate you in a serious manner, you dont deserve that. this is who he really is, until whether he decides this was wrong of him to do or not. if you mention everything annoying hes done to you so far in one post, it will be a lot easier for him to react in an understanding manner to your desire to not be friends. or hopefully he can stop getting angry at you in game, and hopefully he doesnt spend so long on league he has other things to talk about besides it

not being his friend can be hard, since accepting that this is his true self is actually pretty hard, also we have formed such nice little friendship group with others and we see each other alot and now our friendship group is going to be suuuper awkward but i cant handle him anymore :p

You're a good friend, but he may ultimately need to work through this one on his own. He himself needs to realise how his behaviour is now adversely affecting his friendships and sometimes people don't come about that until they lose their friendships. Do what you need to do but you shouldn't feel obliged to stick around when he abuses you over the mistakes you make in the game. Friendship is a two way road.
